text:
East River, showing pier 60, at the foot of East 8th Street, as viewed westward from the pier. This is a set of 3 views; 2 and 3 being viewed in a southwesterly direction and showing the shoreline between East 8th and 7th Streets.

September 11, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Manhattan - Pier 60 - East 8th Street.

title: East River - Manhattan - Pier 60 - East 8th Street.

text:
View 1, and 2:
East 8th Avenue south side and westward across Mercer Street.
P.L. Speer.
October 11, 1939.

View 1, and 2:
East 8th Avenue south side and westward across Mercer Street.
P.L. Speer.
October 11, 1939.

E. 8th St., south side, at Mercer St., showing at the S.E. corner of same, a five story structure which will be reduced to three stories. This building No. 60-62 E. 8th Street is the property of the Sailors Snug Harbor Corporation. The photographer is viewing south eastward to Broadway, which appears at the left margin.

Feb. 4, 1938.

P. L. Sperr,

The same locale one year latter, showing the one-story taxpayer that replaced the above mentioned structure. The view extends at the left to Astor Place where a partial glimpse of Cooper Union Institute appears. Broadway is the intervening thoroughfare.

April 13, 1939

P. L. Sperr
